section.title: Installation, and requirements
section.para: The &app; should be converted into an installable package, instead of building and installing the &app; directly. The source tarball includes a canned build script for Fedora. Running rpmbuild -ta libcxxw-version.tar.bz2 creates the following packages:

listitem.para: The main binary rpm package, with runtime libraries.
The devel subpackage, containing header files and other supporting files used for developing applications that use the &app;.
The devel-internals subpackage, containing additional header files exposing internal library API's, for developing custom display elements.

section.para: Use the following documentation as a guide for preparing an installable the &app; package on platforms other than Fedora.

listitem.para: Install &libcxx; first before installing the &app;. All &libcxx;'s own requirements apply here as well (gcc version, gmake, and others).
XCB library, including its util modules: xcb-xproto, xcb-keysym, xcb-ewmh, xcb-icccm, xcb-image.

note.para: Linux distributions typically have separate runtime and development packages for these libraries. In all cases, the development packages must be installed to build &app;, and only the runtime packages are required to run the applications.

simplesect.title: Configuring and building
simplesect.para: As mentioned above, the &app; should be built into a standalone, installable package. Use the following documentation as a guide to create an installation script or a package.

Run the configure script, followed by make (or gmake), and make install. configure takes the usual options that specify non-default installation directories for various files (see configure --help). Additional options are:

listitem.para: Specifies where pkgconfig configuration file gets installed. The configure script goes through the list of some common directories, and checks if they exist.
This option may be needed to override the default even if configure finds it, and does not complain, if it ends up finding and installs its pkgconfig file into the wrong directory.

simplesect.para: Run (g)make install DESTDIR=/tmp/libcxxw-install. This creates an installation image in the /tmp/libcxxw-install directory, to use as a basis for creating an installable package. A plain (g)make install will do it for real, of course. However, using an installable package is strongly recommended.
In addition to (g)make install, the cxxwtheme.desktop should be included in the installable package, and placed in the desktop application directory (usually /usr/share/applications).

simplesect.title: Developing applications with the &app;
simplesect.para: See &libcxxname;'s autotools instructions. The &app; uses the same build framework. In configure.ac:
&libcxx;'s LIBCXX_INIT gets supplemented by &app;'s LIBCXXW_INIT, The Makefile.am can also use &libcxx;'s @LIBCXX_AM@, if needed, and applications link with -lcxxw and -lcxx
See the examples directory for a working example.

simplesect.title: Packaging different versions of the &app;
simplesect.para: It is possible to install multiple versions of the &app; to accomodate software that gets built with different versions of the &app;. See &libcxx;'s documentation for more information. The same process gets used for the &app; too.

listitem.para: The tools in $bindir (the cxxw and cxxwtheme commands.
The cxxwtheme desktop file, cxxwtheme.desktop (usually in /usr/share/applications, see above).

simplesect.para: The compatibility packages contents are, only:

listitem.para: This directory whose name includes the &app; and &libcxx;'s API/ABI versions contains the runtime libraries. Multiple concurrently-installed version of the &app; get installed into different directories in $libdir.

This directory whose name includes the &app;'s and &libcxx;'s API/ABI version contains the header files. Multiple concurrently-installed version of the &app; install their header files into different directories in $includedir.

This directory whose name includes the &app;'s and &libcxx;'s API/ABI version contains &app;'s visual schemes. Multiple concurrently-installed version of the &app; install their header files into different directories in $includedir.

Only the primary &app; package provides the cxxwtheme to switch display themes. A compatibility &app; library tries to use its corresponding theme with the same name as the primary's package, falling back to the default theme if necessary.

varlistentry.term: The pkgconf/pkg-config and aclocal autoconf macros

listitem.para: The &app; installs a package configuration files and an autoconf macro files into the shared, global pkgconfig and aclocal directories. The names of these files include the &app; version, making it possible to install multiple versions of these files, corresponding to each installed version of the &app;.

simplesect.title: Re-targeting to a different version of &app;
simplesect.para: Re-targeting code that gets compiled with the &app; to use a different version of the &app;, if that's possible, follows the same general process &libcxx;'s, and sets the LIBCXXW_VERSION environment variable which gets checked by the LIBCXXW_INIT macro. This is the &app;'s API/ABI version number which is, generally, the &app; version without the minor release level. One way to obtain the API/ABI version number is that it gets included in the name of the lib subdirectory where &app;'s runtime libraries get installed.

note.para: The version label that gets included in the name of the lib subdirectory includes both the &app; and &libcxx;'s API/ABI versions. Only the &app;'s ABI version gets specified by LIBCXXW_VERSION. The &libcxx; version gets specified by LIBCXX_VERSION.
